meanings.definition: The quality or state of being untenable.
meanings.sent1: The teacher pointed out the untenabilities in the student's argument.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer struggled to defend the untenabilities of the case.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit hilariously highlighted the untenabilities of the absurd situation.
meanings.sent4: The cracks in the foundation of the building symbolized the untenabilities of the construction.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds looming overhead represented the untenabilities of the impending storm.

meanings.definition: The inability to be defended or justified.
meanings.sent1: The critic exposed the untenabilities of the author's controversial theory.
meanings.sent2: The politician faced scrutiny due to the untenabilities of his actions.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt to explain the trick only revealed the untenabilities of his explanation.
meanings.sent4: The broken promises highlighted the untenabilities of the company's commitment.
meanings.sent5: The unanswered questions left a trail of untenabilities in the investigation.
